intro: Eremostachys integior, commonly known as the smooth eremostachys, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
